issue.title: canvas and AdGuard firefox extention
issue.body:
### AdGuard Extension version

4.2.189

### Browser version

118.0.2 (64-bit)

### OS version

Ubuntu 20.x

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Block trackers

### Issue Details

I've recently encountered a problem with the AdGuard Firefox Extension that has affected my ability to log into various educational institutions' Canvas websites.

Instead of being redirected to the Canvas dashboard or intranet, I am sent back to the school's Canvas homepage.

### Expected Behavior

After entering my login credentials, I should be redirected to the Canvas dashboard or intranet of the educational institution.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Information

    This issue started approximately a week ago.
    It's not limited to a single institution's Canvas website. I've tried logging into multiple institutions' Canvas websites and the issue persists on all of them.
    When I disable the AdGuard Firefox Extension, I am able to log in normally.

It's unclear if this issue is caused by a change in the Canvas platform, something on the school's end, or an update to the AdGuard Firefox Extension. I wanted to bring it to your attention in case others are experiencing similar issues. I hope a solution can be found soon as the extension has otherwise been very helpful.

comment.body: @KristofferD Hello! It looks very much like a problem with the filters, not the extension. If you add the website to Allowlist, does the problem persist?

issue.title: Add hint while using YouTube
issue.body:
### Issue Details

YouTube updates its ad blocking detection codes daily and users are not aware of it. So they will rate your products poorly.

### Proposed solution

To solve this, add small hint popup for YouTube domain and notify users in that hint. Ex: "`YouTube's adblock detection system is updated daily. Update filters regularly or daily for better ad blocking`" hint popup can be added.

### Alternative solution

_No response_

issue.title: AdGuard extention does not work on Firefox beta, nightly
issue.body:
### AdGuard Extension version

4.2.168

### Browser version

firefox nightly 120.0a1

### OS version

Android 11

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter, AdGuard Experimental filter, Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Block trackers, Remove tracking parameters, Hide your search queries, Send websites signals not to track you, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Hide Referrer from third parties, Disable WebRTC

### Issue Details

 all web pages are treatedas a "secured page", so Adblocking does not work at all.
It occuts beta, nightly version only.
original Firefox and  iceraven works fine.

### Expected Behavior

Does not treal all web page as "secured page".

### Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: Add support for RegEx for domains in hiding rules (to match uBO's support)
issue.body:
### Issue Details

While asterisk wildcarding for domains in hiding rules have had a wide consensus to be limited to 1 per entry (tied to TLDs), I've run into a situation on Nitter and by extension InvidioUS and Mastodon where one TLD wildcard simply isn't enough, and that additional flexible domain values would be a gamechanger for those sites in AdGuard.

As the situation currently stands, User Rules consider e.g. `/^nitter\..*$/#?#.timeline-item:has-text(tweet)` and `nitter.*.*#?#.timeline-item:has-text(brony)` to be invalid domains, so I've had to look at https://github.com/zedeus/nitter/wiki/Instances#public for working instances, then try to view a tweet on each domain shown as working to see if they actually do work (e.g. if PFPs show up, tweet shows up, may later have to test if embeds show up when linked to on Discord), and then use every single confirmed domain in the hiding rule, leading to stuff like `nitter.*,nitter.unixfox.eu,nitter.mint.lgbt,nitter.esmailelbob.xyz,nitter.d420.de,nitter.x86-64-unknown-linux-gnu.zip,nitter.woodland.cafe,nitter.dafriser.be,nitter.catsarch.com,nitter.perennialte.ch,nitter.salastil.com,nitter.uni-sonia.com,n.opnxng.com,nitter.ktachibana.party##.timeline-item:has-text(brony)`, which may possibly have to be re-tested every 4 weeks or so, if not more often.

### Proposed solution

The technical details behind https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uBlock-issues/issues/2905 (which in turn were added in uBO 1.47.x onwards, almost a year ago), though I don't know much about the underlying code details.

Long story short, add support for RegEx in domains, in order to do stuff like `/^nitter\..*$/#?#.timeline-item:has-text(brony)`, and to synchronise syntax support with uBO.

### Alternative solution

Double or multiple asterisk wildcarding for domains in hiding rules, to do stuff like `nitter.*.*##(...)`. Would be difficult for me to implement in multi-adblocker lists of mine, but I've been through worse projects.

issue.title: Chrome doesn't show Google search results
issue.body:
### AdGuard Extension version

4.2.189

### Browser version

Version 117.0.5938.150 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### OS version

Windows 11 Pro (22H2

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard Social Media filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Issue Details

After a few seconds Google chrome search results disappears (blank white backgrond). Refreching the page, results are shown again for a few seconds before it disappears (blank white background).
I trased it to my adblocker by switching off all extentions and then switching on. Then refrech page and see if the page go blank. As soon as I switch on my Adblocker, search results disappears after a few seconds.
![Chrome blank screen](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/assets/147542664/ed262c8a-77c8-4d03-a1fc-b922287aac5c)


### Expected Behavior

That my search results will stay on the screen as previous (before adblocker update) and only ads are gone as per adblocker.

### Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/assets/147542664/28c53f6f-1fd9-43b6-927f-861fb070b920)

</details>



### Additional Information

It only happens on my Desktop PC. My Chrome on my Dell notebook seems un affected.

release.body:
### Review status
- Chrome: Published (Phased release at 5%)
- AMO: In review
- Opera: Published
- Edge: Published

Hopefully, this update will bring something nice into your everyday browsing — at least if you’re a YouTube or Android user.

### Addressing YouTube’s ad blocker detection

Some users reported that AdGuard was detected on the YouTube website — they could not watch videos without disabling the extension. To address this issue, we’ve updated our scriptlets.

### Adapting for Firefox on Android

Firefox for Android is making changes, and we’re keeping up. To continue working with Android, the extension for Firefox now uses event pages. But this change is rather unnoticeable.

## Changelog

### Improvements

* Remove unclickable space between menu items [#2198](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2198)

* Automatically fill out OS name and version when reporting incorrect blocking [#2535](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2535)

### Fixes

* Labels of radio buttons and checkboxes are not clickable in the rule wizard [#2204](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2204)

### Scriptlets (JavaScript enhancement for filtering rules)

* [Scriptlets](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/releases) updated to v1.9.83

### Important for filter maintainers

* Add `!#else` pre-processor directive support [#20](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersDownloader/issues/20)

##
### How to install stable:
* [Chrome](https://agrd.io/extension_chrome)
* [Firefox](https://agrd.io/extension_firefox)
* [Edge](https://agrd.io/extension_edge)
* [Opera](https://agrd.io/extension_opera)

### How to install beta:
* [Chrome/Edge/Opera](https://agrd.io/extension_chrome_beta)
* [Firefox](https://agrd.io/extension_firefox_beta)
* [adguard-api](https://static.adguard.com/extensions/adguardadblocker/beta/adguard-api.zip)

issue.title: shopee.co.th - parameters are not removed when opening a product link in the same tab
issue.body:
### AdGuard Extension version

4.2.189

### Browser version

Chrome 118

### OS version

Windows 11

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Issue Details

The original issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/164592.
The problem is that parameters are not removed if you open the product link in the same tab. To remove them, an additional refresh page is required.
STR:
1. Enable mentioned filter in the issue, also check the filters update
2. Register an account, login
3. Open https://shopee.co.th/Wash-Waxes-cat.11044950.11045107.11045552
4. Click on any product link
5. You'll see that the item will be opened in the same tab, but such parameters as `sp_atk`, `xptdk` won't be removed.

### Expected Behavior

The parameters must be removed on 5 step without refreshing the page.

### Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Additional Information

_No response_
